Detailed Description

Class ExecutionContext provides the basic infrastructure for applications and service threads:
  • It holds a list of additional user defined dispatchers.
  • It handles messages, which are registered for this execution context.
  • It processes active waits using conditions. These functionalities establish the basic means of implementing applications and service threads in APOXI.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum ExecutionContext::Type
 

Currently there are two types of ApoxiThreads which have an ExecutionContext.

Enumerator:
APPLICATION 
SERVICE_THREAD

Tells if msg is accepted.

Implemented in Application, and ServiceThread.

void ExecutionContext::AddDispatcher (  UserDispatcher *  disp  ) 
 

Adds a UserDispatcher to the application and invokes UserDispatcher::RegisterMessages.

virtual void ExecutionContext::AddTimer (  Timer &  timer  )  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Adds the timer to the context.

Implemented in Application, and ServiceThread.

BOOLEAN ExecutionContext::ContainsDispatcher (  const UserDispatcher *  disp  )  const
 

return Tells if the context contains disp.

ExecutionContext & ExecutionContext::GetCurrentContext (   )  [static]
 

Returns the ExecutionContext of the currently running ApoxiThread. Critical code which might run in non-ApoxiThread context must call ExecutionContext::IsContextAvailable() before to check if an ExecutionContext is available. Calling this method in any non-ApoxiThread context ends in an assertion.

const Guid & ExecutionContext::GetGuid (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns:
GUID to identify the execution context. This is needed for example in AlarmManager to persist the application and re-identify it after re-boot.

virtual Type ExecutionContext::GetType (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Returns:
Type of ExectionContext.

Implemented in Application, and ServiceThread.

BOOLEAN ExecutionContext::HandleDispatcherList (  const Message &  msg  )  [protected]
 

virtual BOOLEAN ExecutionContext::HandleMsg (  const MessageReferrer &  msg_ref  )  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Handles the message which the message referrer msg_ref points to.

Implemented in Application, and ServiceThread.

BOOLEAN ExecutionContext::IsInContext (  const ExecutionContext *  context = 0  )  [static]
 

Checks if the currently active context is equal to context. If context is 0 then it checks if the system is currently in any APOXI context.

virtual void ExecutionContext::RegisterMessage (  MsgId  msg_id  )  [pure virtual]
 

Registers a message to the ExecutionContext. Only registered messages are accepted and handled.

Implemented in Application, and ServiceThread.

void ExecutionContext::RemoveDispatcher (  UserDispatcher *  disp  ) 
 

Removes the dispatcher from the application and invokes UserDispatcher::UnregisterMessages

virtual void ExecutionContext::RemoveTimer (  Timer &  timer  )  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Removes the timer from the context.

Implemented in Application, and ServiceThread.

virtual void ExecutionContext::UnregisterMessage (  MsgId  msg_id  )  [pure virtual]
 

Unregisters a message from the ExecutionContext. Messages with ID msg_id are no more accepted.

Implemented in Application, and ServiceThread.

static void ExecutionContext::Wait (  const Condition &  cond  )  [inline, static]
 

Blocking function call until the condition is fulfilled. While waiting, the context is still able to handle messages in parallel.

Parameters:
cond Condition to wait for.
